metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35506 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the am53c974 SCSI host bus adapter emulation of QEMU in versions before 6.0.0 during the handling of the 'Information Transfer' command (CMD_TI). This flaw allows a privileged guest user to crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution with the privileges of the QEMU process.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> same commits as CVE-2020-35504 qemu in hirsute and older doesn't implement FIFO, it doesn't appear to be vulnerable to this specific CVE

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
